title: Growing Grapes for Juice Jelly or Wine - Spring Fever Garden Forums

subtasks: Selecting a suitable vineyard site with proper elevation and slope
Choosing a south-facing slope for optimal sunlight and temperature
Protecting the vineyard from wind through shelter belts or structures
Considering soil pH and adjusting with sulfur if necessary for hybrid grapes
Understanding nitrogen management to prevent excessive growth
Planting dormant rootstock after the frost period
Proper weed and mulch management for young vines
Establishing a trellis system for vine support
Winter pruning to remove 80% of non-fruiting wood
Chute thinning to control canopy density
Managing lateral chutes and leaf canopy
Crop thinning for optimal cluster ripening
Monitoring for herbicide injury (e.g., 2,4-D)
Protecting from bird, deer, rabbit, and raccoon damage
Addressing issues with Spotted Wing Drosophila
Understanding the cold hardiness needs of North Dakota
Evaluating cultivars like Dakota Primus, Radiant, Somerset Seedless, etc.
